trans-unit.source: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.
trans-unit.target: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for maps
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for maps

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for maps
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for maps

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: The map control can display road maps, aerial, 3D, views, directions, search results, and traffic.
trans-unit.target: The map control can display road maps, aerial, 3D, views, directions, search results, and traffic.

trans-unit.source: On a map, you can display the user's location, directions, and points of interest.
trans-unit.target: On a map, you can display the user's location, directions, and points of interest.

trans-unit.source: A map can also show aerial 3D views, Streetside views, traffic, transit, and local businesses.
trans-unit.target: A map can also show aerial 3D views, Streetside views, traffic, transit, and local businesses.

trans-unit.source: example of a map, basic view
trans-unit.target: example of a map, basic view

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a map control when you want a map within your app that allows users to view app-specific or general geographic information.
trans-unit.target: Use a map control when you want a map within your app that allows users to view app-specific or general geographic information.

trans-unit.source: Having a map control in your app means that users don't have to go outside your app to get that information.
trans-unit.target: Having a map control in your app means that users don't have to go outside your app to get that information.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you don't mind users going outside your app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that information.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you don't mind users going outside your app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that information.

trans-unit.source: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app to display specific maps, directions, and search results.
trans-unit.target: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app to display specific maps, directions, and search results.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Maps app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228341).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Maps app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228341).

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Use ample screen space (or the entire screen) to display the map so that users don't have to pan and zoom excessively to view geographical information.
trans-unit.target: Use ample screen space (or the entire screen) to display the map so that users don't have to pan and zoom excessively to view geographical information.

trans-unit.source: If the map is only used to present a static, informational view, then using a smaller map might be more appropriate.
trans-unit.target: If the map is only used to present a static, informational view, then using a smaller map might be more appropriate.

trans-unit.source: If you go with a smaller, static map, base its dimensions on usability—small enough to conserve enough screen real estate, but large enough to remain legible.
trans-unit.target: If you go with a smaller, static map, base its dimensions on usability—small enough to conserve enough screen real estate, but large enough to remain legible.

trans-unit.source: Embed the points of interest in the map scene using [**map elements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637034); any additional information can be displayed as transient UI that overlays the map scene.
trans-unit.target: Embed the points of interest in the map scene using [**map elements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637034); any additional information can be displayed as transient UI that overlays the map scene.
